thread.title: Palisades goalie Madelyn Nicholas nearly unbeatable in Colonial League semis
thread.title_full: Palisades goalie Madelyn Nicholas nearly unbeatable in Colonial League semis

title: Palisades goalie Madelyn Nicholas nearly unbeatable in Colonial League semis
text:
That’s because Palisades High School goalkeeper Madelyn Nicholas was on fire. 
The sophomore made 17 saves as Southern Lehigh edged the Pirates 1-0 in double overtime of the Colonial League semifinals on Tuesday. 
“The game would have been over a lot sooner if Maddie hadn’t been in there,” Palisades coach Chris Willman said. 
Spartans senior Baleigh Bradley ensured her team avoided penalty kicks – a daunting prospect with Nicholas in the goal – by finally getting a shot in with 2:54 remaining in the second extra period. 
Within her great performance, Nicholas made two close-range saves of Southern Lehigh headers off corner kicks in overtime. 
Willman says Nicholas has grown from the difficult reps she picked up as a freshman. 
“Last year, the team that we had wasn’t as strong, so she got to see a lot of those shots throughout the year,” he said. “They’ve become so routine for her that we don’t panic; we know that she’s there and is going to make a big save for us in big games.” 
Her play has become so expected that the Pirates (12-4-3) aren’t surprised, even if spectators are in awe. 
“It’s routine for us, but I’m sure it’s pretty impressive for someone on the outside perspective looking in,” Willman said. 
Of course, the fact Nicholas faced so many shots while the Spartans dominated possession is something the Pirates aren’t thrilled about. 
“I think it was a very good defensive effort,” Willman said. “We didn’t have a whole lot of offense. Southern beat us in just about every single stat. They were the team that deserved to win.” 
The Pirates looked dangerous during a handful of counterattacks on Tuesday, but will need a more complete performance to advance in the upcoming District 11 tournament. 
“I think we kind of played as individuals tonight and not as a team, and that’s something we’re going to need to work on for districts,” Willman said. 
Either way, Palisades’ goalkeeper is already in championship form.
